column5: Good going Paul    Some nice gators for your efforts I won't comment on the glove thing cause I never use'em but the Spinnerbaits... I've made quite a few last year and my favorite colors are white or black
Long skinny pike and some real wicked crisp pics.  Thanks for posting.
Sure sure...prove it >>>>i double dog dare ya  Nice fishies Paul

Me and a Bud planned this day a week ago.St louis in the morning to try a new to us spot.Plus i wanted to try my Spinner Baits  Well after today, i have a new goto lure. Spinnerbaits are awesome.Tried a few colors, and Chartreuse/Orange with a Green Slurpy was the ticket today.Fished from 8am till 4 pm when an approaching storm forced us off the water. All in all we caught 12 nice pike, and numerous of an OOS species which we released unharmed without pics .Here are pics of the 2 best of the day. All the fish caught today were on Spinnerbaits.  Of Ya forgot.This next fish was caught on a lite fly rod, and sone kinda red and white fly.
My best friend is known as the 'spinner man' has been since I've known him 30+ years. . . In a trout river a #3 Mepps is a killer bait .  . .  have fun with your new toys.  A
Nice catch guys. Spinner baits are one of the best. For 30 yrs. I've always had lots in the tackle box. I'm taking a Pike day on Friday this week. Tight Lines!
nice gators, sweet to battle one on the fly i bet
Nice pike Mercman, good to hear spinner baits are working for you.  You should try to find some hatchet/tomahawk blade spinnerbaits, they work awesome for pike, bass, walleye, and muskie.
Nice work Paul those are some nice Pike.  Got to love adding another awesome bait to the box with confidence using it to.
Nice pair of gators you have there congratz!
excellent fish, Paul...spinnerbaits are one of my favorite lures, they seem to work well for multi species

congrats on the first slime of the year in boat MM , and on a new bait at that. Nice way to start the season.  I, like you have barely used spinnerbaits - but after that thread will be giving them more time in the water this year.
nice going
Nice report, thanks for sharing.

If you are going to use SB, i would suggest you add a stinger hook to them. I did lose a couple of big fish because of short strikes. I could see them follow it right up to the boat and nip at the skirt, then turn an swim away.With a stinger, i would have boated a few more fish.
Good job Paul!  Thanks for pics.  Just what I needed before a weekend of pike fishing

Way to go! Always very satisfying to catch fish on a new lure....now you've got the confidence in them.  One thing I do to all my pike spinnerbaits that have rubber skirts, is take the wire from a twist-tie, and wrap it around where the skirt is secured to the bait.  A couple twists, fold it over and trim off the excess wire, it doesn't get in the way and really holds the skirt on for a long time.
A good primer for eeryon who is pike fishing this weekend! Team 2 KNOWS there is a 50 incher in those waters. Haha
So Merc, how did you fish the SB?  Were they hitting it while burning it near the surface? Were you jigging it deeper? Slow???

We were tossing them into the weeds and cattails, and climbing them over fallen wild rice stems.They are awesome for that. The Pike concentraion in this small area was amazing.I think they just finished spawning in the area we were in. They seemed to work better with a Mr Twister threaded on the hook.Im my case, they loved the Slurpy tails. All in all, awesome lures. Although OOS, i accidentally caught my PB Bucket mouth, while fishing Pike yesterday. 4.3 lbs
You took time to weight it??? Shame on you!  Yep, super versatile lures hey? As you try them in some other situations too they'll grow on you.  Nice fish too BTW!!! Congrats!
Nice gators Paul!!  Spinnerbaits are awesome, versatile, lures. Don't leave home without them.
Nice going Paul, those are some beauty pike!
Couldn't find the big girls today.Water temps are climbing fast.I did find a Walleye hole with the help of MTP. I'm gonna fish it later this afternoon once the weekend warriors are off the water.
Look at the beek on the second one.   You got some real good advice on your spinner bait thread. Glad to see you gave them a go, and it worked out for ya Paul.
Thanks Brian....gonna give a chatreuse one a go after supper, for walleye.I added stingers to them, and will put a bit worm on it to give it some flavour
How do those three eyed walleyes up there taste....
Nice report Paul. I can just tell that you had a blast out there.
